summary: Email chain between U.S. Department of Justice prosecutors and UK law firm Blackfords LLP regarding a request for a voluntary interview with Prince Andrew, Duke of York, as part of the Jeffrey Epstein investigation. The prosecutors seek to discuss his relationship and communications with Epstein and his associates.

persons.name: Gary Bloxsome
persons.role: Partner at Blackfords LLP, legal representative
persons.context: Partner at Blackfords LLP who is corresponding with U.S. Department of Justice prosecutors regarding representation of Prince Andrew, Duke of York, and scheduling a call to discuss a voluntary interview request.

persons.name: Daniel Cundy
persons.role: Assistant U.S. Attorney, Southern District of New York
persons.context: Federal prosecutor from the Southern District of New York who is investigating conduct relating to Jeffrey Epstein and is requesting a voluntary interview with Prince Andrew via his legal counsel.

persons.name: Jennifer Richardson
persons.context: Appears to be copied on the email correspondence between Gary Bloxsome and the U.S. Department of Justice prosecutors, likely a colleague or legal staff.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Central figure in the U.S. Department of Justice investigation; the prosecutors wish to inquire about the Duke of York's relationship and communications with him and his associates.

persons.name: HRH the Duke of York
persons.role: Client of Blackfords LLP, subject of interview request
persons.context: Prince Andrew, who is represented by Blackfords LLP and is the subject of a voluntary law enforcement interview request by U.S. prosecutors investigating Jeffrey Epstein.

connections.description: Gary Bloxsome confirms that his firm represents HRH the Duke of York in correspondence with U.S. prosecutors.
Prosecutor Daniel Cundy is communicating with attorney Gary Bloxsome to request a voluntary interview with his client, the Duke of York.
U.S. prosecutors wish to inquire about the Duke of York's relationship and communications with Jeffrey Epstein and his associates, indicating a known connection.
Daniel Cundy is a federal prosecutor investigating conduct relating to Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Scheduled preliminary telephone call
events.description: A preliminary telephone call is scheduled between U.S. Department of Justice prosecutors and Gary Bloxsome to discuss the request for a voluntary interview with the Duke of York.

events.title: Initial DOJ inquiry to legal counsel
events.description: Daniel Cundy, Assistant U.S. Attorney, sends an initial email to Gary Bloxsome to confirm representation of the Duke of York and inquire about contacting him regarding the Epstein investigation.

locations: Hill House, 1 Mint Walk, Croydon, CR0 1EA
keyFacts: U.S. Department of Justice prosecutors from the Southern District of New York are seeking a voluntary law enforcement interview with Prince Andrew, Duke of York, regarding his relationship and communications with Jeffrey Epstein and his associates.
The Duke of York is represented by the UK law firm Blackfords LLP, with partner Gary Bloxsome as the point of contact.
The prosecutors initiated contact directly with counsel, acknowledging they could use diplomatic and law enforcement channels but chose to inquire with legal representation first.
A preliminary telephone call was scheduled for January 10, 2020, to discuss the interview request in detail.
The correspondence confirms that the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein includes inquiries about his associates and allegations that have arisen publicly.
